author: Phenix
title: Anakin's ready to race Sebulba!
review:
Another impulse buy exclusive to Toys r us.  Retail will be $4.99 instead of the normal $399 USD as such. 

The podracer is probably a competitive design for the Tatooine world set. 

The scale is the same, making it a great companion set for 9675.
There is actually room to put both on the Tatooine base for a dramatic photo finish.


Pros:

- micro design captures spirit of the podracer from the movies.
- pink lightsaber blade
- triple axle
- built in base
- technic arm engine nacelles good use of parts.

Cons: 

- One clip in from makes model unstable
- not really for play
- red 2x1 single hole tiles on bottom of engines seem pointless.

All in all, a good buy to go with sebulbas racer, or for shelf builders.  Not so much for kids that want to build, play, and rebuild.

author: McJoJo_McBob
title: Mini Set Podracing Winner Coming Through!
review:
I recently received this set for free at TRU with the purchases of set 7869 Battle For Geonosis & 9489 Endor Rebel Trooper and Imperial Battle Pack.


Box/Instructions

This set comes inside a polybag. It has the new creepy Darth Maul logo where he looks like he wants to eat you. On the back is the usual for a polybag with Max,the LEGO Club logo with a circle going around him saying,RATE THIS SET!


the instructions had no mistakes & I had no missing pieces,actually having extra:]!


Parts

This set has very useful parts, especially the clear parts because I keep missing out on chances to get a STAP or maybe even 2.Also,the light medium stone grey motor 1x2x3 piece could become useful as a support or something else in a MOC.


The Build

The build is very simple and took me about 3 minutes.


The Completed Model

The completed model is a somewhat good polybag to put alone on display or just
something to rebuild into something[s] else.


Summary

Overall,I recommend to get it on sale at Amazon.com or maybe Target as a $3.99 promotional,I do not recommend to get it from Toys "R" Us though.Also, this could be considered a good stocking stuffer when it comes Christmas time.

author: NWB
title: Review #1 30057 Anakin's Pod Racer
review:
Ok, here is my first review, which is of the 30057 Anakin’s Podracer. This early 2012 issued set so far has only has been seen at ToysRUs in the USA and in the UK. The one I found was in the STAR WARS part of the LEGO section and was priced at $4.99 USD each. You can also get it for around that same price on Bricklink. You can find catalog entries at Brickset: http://www.brickset.com/detail/?set=30057-1 and Bricklink: http://www.bricklink.com/catalogItem.asp?S=30057-1


~Packing

The packing for this set is a vinyl bag featuring of course the set and the regular advised age, set name and number of pieces. In the upper right hand corner is Darth Maul.

[img]http://farm9.staticflickr.com/8514/8347331995_047a4707cc.jpg[/img]

~Parts

This set contains 38 parts 19 of them are unique. With a couple of new ones like a 1x2 plate with 1 stud and groove, and a trans pink light saber blade which has only showed up in a few other sets. Below are photos of all the parts and the noted parts.

4/5

[img]http://farm9.staticflickr.com/8232/8348390684_ed54c20d2c.jpg[/img]

~Minifigures

There are no Minifigures included in this set.

0/0


~Instructions

There pretty straight forward  there are only 8 steps and like most poly-bags there simple.

[img]http://farm9.staticflickr.com/8080/8348392166_77eb9e6ec4_n.jpg[/img]

[img]http://farm9.staticflickr.com/8080/8348390858_da2cd1e057_n.jpg[/img]

~The Build

The build is very simple, as said earlier it only has eight steps to complete the build, and only takes a couple of  minutes First they have you build the base and the cockpit followed by the engines, which includes some Technic building which helps for a more accurate end result. When you compare this set (30057) with the other mini podracer set that LEGO has made this new one is defiantly more superior to the other 2003 version (4485). The '03 version contains 22 pieces compared to the new pod which has 38 pieces in it. A great design for a mini-set, and overall a far improvement to the '03 version.

4/5


[img]http://farm9.staticflickr.com/8378/8348391130_195d4fd4a3.jpg[/img]

[img]http://farm9.staticflickr.com/8466/8347333003_559a97abd3.jpg[/img]

~Playability

There is not a ton of playability in this set other that just running around with your unbelievably fast Pod Racer around the house.

3/5


~Conclusion

In conclusion it is a very good and well designed model especially for it’s scale. It is a bit expensive for the 38 pieces at 13.132 cents per piece, but still a good model and I would recommend it to any STAR WARS fan and also for poly-bag collectors.

4/5


[img]http://farm9.staticflickr.com/8515/8348391408_8f0441b249.jpg[/img]

Overall: 15/20


You can also find this review at my Google+ page here: https://plus.google.com/u/0/114440444827531838932/posts/KqKBD2FBmMK, and if you have any suggestions on how I can improve any of my reviews I would welcome any comments. Thank you for reading this review and have a great day!

last updated on Dec. 12, 2012
